wikitext.*:
'''The First 'Silmarillion' Map''' is a map of [[Beleriand]] drawn by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] on single sheet (likely dating from c. 1926-30<ref group=note>[[Christopher Tolkien]] believes the map to be contemporary with the manuscript "Sketch of the Mythology"; see {{SM|2}}, p. 11.</ref>), with "two supplementary sheets, giving an Eastern and a Western extension to the main or central map".<ref>{{SM|4}}</ref> The name [[Thimbalt]], which probably refers to another fortress such as Angband, only appears on this map. Thimbalt was struck out using a pencil on this map.<ref>{{SM|4b}}</ref>.

File:The First 'Silmarillion' Map in 3D - Airyyn.png|Axonometric view of the First Map, by [[User:Airyn|Airynn]] (2017).
</gallery>
